skill.name: migration-tracker
skill.description: Context for ongoing migration from old Portfolio Buddy app. Use when: fixing bugs, adding migrated features, checking feature parity, or understanding why certain code exists. Contains list of 40 features being migrated and known issues.
skill.summary: Context for ongoing migration from old Portfolio Buddy app. Use when: fixing bugs, adding migrated f...
skill.author: 5MinFutures

security_audit.summary: This is a read-only documentation skill containing only SKILL.md (415 lines). The skill-report.json explicitly confirms no executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution. All 82 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer incorrectly flagging documentation text as code.

content.user_title: Track Portfolio Buddy migration status and feature parity
content.value_statement: Managing a large migration project without clear tracking leads to confusion about completed work and missing features. This skill provides a structured record of 40 migration features with their status, known issues, and tech debt priorities.
actual_capabilities: Tracks 40 migration features with status indicators
Documents completed, in-progress, and not-started features
Lists known issues and their workarounds
Records tech debt and refactoring needs
Shows feature parity comparison between old and new app
limitations: Does not modify any files or code
Does not execute commands or scripts
Does not connect to databases or APIs
Provides context only - requires human review of actual code

use_cases.title: Understand migration context
use_cases.description: Quickly understand why certain code patterns exist by referencing documented migration decisions and known issues.

use_cases.title: Track feature progress
use_cases.description: View current migration status, identify gaps in feature parity, and prioritize remaining work based on ICE scores.

use_cases.title: Onboard to codebase
use_cases.description: Learn what changed from the old app, understand the tech stack evolution, and find known issues to avoid.

prompt_templates.title: Check feature status
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the migration-tracker skill for the status of [feature name]. Is it completed, in progress, or not started?

prompt_templates.title: Find known issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the migration-tracker skill to look up any known issues related to [symptom or component name] and their workarounds.

prompt_templates.title: Compare old vs new
prompt_templates.prompt: According to the migration-tracker, what changed from the old app to the new app for [specific component or feature]?

prompt_templates.title: Get priorities
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the top ICE-scored migration priorities from the migration-tracker skill. What should we focus on next?

output_examples.input: What is the status of the Sortino Ratio feature?
output: Fixed downside deviation calculation (now properly annualized using sqrt(365))
Files: PortfolioSection.tsx - Added riskFreeRate state and calculation

output_examples.input: What are the top migration priorities right now?
output: 1. Error boundaries (ICE Score: 50.4) - High impact, easy to implement
2. Export to Excel (ICE Score: 44.8) - User-requested feature
3. Remove Recharts (ICE Score: 30) - Quick win, technical cleanup
4. Fix TypeScript violations (ICE Score: 27) - Code quality

output_examples.input: What features are not yet migrated?
output: Risk scenario modeling - Requires new backend logic (Monte Carlo, stress testing)
Export to Excel - CSV export only, Excel pending
Historical comparison - Backend ready, UI pending
Symbol filtering - Date filtering complete, symbol/strategy filtering needed

best_practices: Reference the migration tracker before working on features to understand existing implementations
Check known issues section first when encountering unexpected behavior
Update the skill with new findings and resolved issues to keep documentation current
anti_patterns: Ignoring the migration tracker and duplicating work already completed
Making changes without checking if a known issue or regression exists
Assuming feature parity without consulting the documented comparison table

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Provide context by loading the skill before your query.

faq.question: What is the current migration completion rate?
faq.answer: 90% complete - 36 of 40 features migrated. 3 in progress, 2 not started.

faq.question: How do I add a new feature to the tracker?
faq.answer: Edit the SKILL.md file to add your feature under the appropriate status section with commit references.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill. It does not access files, networks, or execute code.

faq.question: What should I do if I find a bug?
faq.answer: Check the Known Issues section first. If not listed, document it there with symptoms, root cause, and workaround.

faq.question: How does this differ from a regular documentation file?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for AI consumption. It structures information for easy lookup and context retrieval during coding tasks.
